Header.title: depression detection
Header.paragraph: Depression detection using Prolog uses logical rules to analyze symptoms like mood changes and sleep issues. By inputting symptoms, Prolog infers depression levels, aiding in mental health assessments.

About.paragraph: Depression detection using Prolog employs logical reasoning to analyze symptoms and infer potential mental health conditions. This approach supports preliminary assessments by identifying patterns in mood, behavior, and physical indicators linked to depression.

Services.name: Symptom Analysis
Services.text: Prolog analyzes mood changes, sleep patterns, and other indicators to detect signs of depression effectively.

Services.name: Diagnostic Support
Services.text: Logical inference rules in Prolog assist healthcare professionals in preliminary depression assessments.

Services.name: Customizable Solutions
Services.text: Prolog allows creating tailored rules to fit specific diagnostic needs and frameworks for mental health.

Services.name: Rule-Based Modeling
Services.text: The system models relationships between symptoms to provide accurate and consistent results.

Services.name: Scalable Framework
Services.text: Prolog-based systems can scale to accommodate diverse datasets and diagnostic scenarios.

Services.name: Integration Ready
Services.text: Prolog integrates seamlessly with existing healthcare systems, enhancing mental health evaluation processes.
